title: The Lotus Eaters - No Sense of Sin [1984]
description:
Refreshing (and totally cynicism-free) collection of songs celebrating innocent pleasures. The Lotus Eaters were a Liverpudlian duo who scored one UK hit with the summer anthem "The First Picture Of You" and then released this album to cash in. 

Most of the album has the same freshness as the single - surging melodies worthy of a 60s girl group mark "You Don&#039;t Need Someone New" and "German Girl". This is just as well as, to a cynic like me, the lyrics are frequently hilariously earnest. These are clearly people who have never thought anything bad about anyone. 

If you can stomach the unabashed romanticism, this is actually a lovely record.

Tracklisting:
 
01		German Girl	   
02		Love Still Flows	   
03		Can You Keep A Secret	   
04		Out On Your Own	   
05		Put Your Touch On Love

12		Two Virgins Tender	   
13		My Happy Dream	   
14		The Evidence	   
15		Endless

17		Church At Llanbadrig
